title: SL aims for 3.3M tourists by 2025
content: The Sri Lankan Tourism Development Authority (SLTDA) is planning to attract more than 3.3 million tourists to the country by 2025, on an optimistic scenario, or 2.3 million visitors in a pessimistic scenario. Last year, the SLTDA was planning to attract 185,679 tourists into the country after opening its boarders for international travellers in January.As per statistics released by the SLTDA in 2021, Sri Lanka managed to welcome more than 194,495 tourists into the country.This year, itâ€™s planning to attract more than one million international travellers on a optimistic scenario or 529,808 visitors in a pessimistic scenario. As per latest statistics it is well on the path to achieve its ambitious goal.During January this year, Sri Lanka welcomed more than 82,327 travellers in to the county, higher than the targeted 79,764 visitors.During the period ended 10 February, Sri Lanka has managed to welcome more than 113,679 international visitors in to the country, with the first ten days of February alone bringing in 31,343 visitors.For February, the SLTDA is targeting more than 73,114 visitors arriving in the country.
